Fish farmers in Ernakulam take to sale o.description: KOCHI: Inland fish farmers, who are struggling to sell their produce in the absence of marketing avenues, have reason to cheer as a new trend of live fish sales is fast catching up. A handful of young fish farmers have embarked on sale of live fish either at their own farms or specific sales points near highways or small towns. Advantages are many: Consumers can get chemical-free fish fresh from the nets and since there are no middlemen, farmers can earn a good revenue. But it can be risky if there are not enough sales because frequent transfer from ponds and life fish sale tanks can stress out the fish. Such sales outlets have come up in areas like Perumbavoor and Kothamangalam, which have lot of inland fish farms. “We are getting a lot of calls from farmers who want to know whether we can sell their fish,” said Shaji Varghese, a farmer associated with Farmers’ Facilitation Centre, formed under Sanskara, a cultural organization at Kothamangalam. Varghese, who works as a promoter under Fish Farmer Development Agency (FFDA) and owns a farm at Varapettty said the outlet could solve a major issue faced by fish farmers. His live fish sale outlet was recently moved to a plot near Bishop’s House at Kothamangalam in the highway. Encouraged by the prospects, more farmers are joining the bandwagon. Dhanesh, who grows fish at Methala village, has gone one step further and introduced mobile live fish sale to reach out to more customers. “The response so far was quite good but we should have a minimum sale of 50kg every day if it is to be profitable since I am using a hired vehicle,” said Dhanesh. While there are many takers for live fish, lack of diversity is a problem. Most farmers sell only Gift Tilapia and buyers who look for variety may find it disappointing. Some buyers have an aversion to inland farmed fish because of the feeling that they are less tasty. “The fish tastes good if it is farmed scientifically with proper feed. But most farmers tend to feed fish with chicken waste because fish feed tends to be costly,” said Renju, who has a farm at Kothamangalam and sells around 40kg of fish every day. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. Government to take a call based on Sreed.description: KOCHI: Heeding to the state government’s request to help fix the issues related to Palarivattom flyover, Delhi Metro Rail Corporation’s (DMRC) principal adviser E Sreedharan inspected the flyover on Monday. Sreedharan, along with a team of experts from Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs) Kanpur and Madras, visited the flyover around 8am and inspected the restoration works. The flyover has been closed for traffic for more than a month. Though Sreedharan spent around one and a half hours at the flyover inspecting the pillars, girders and the cracks, he refused to openly speak about the defects. According to DMRC sources, he is expected to submit an inspection report directly to the state government in the coming days based on which the state government will take a call on whether the flyover should be restored or demolished. Sreedharan was roped in for the inspection by chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan after a meeting with PWD minister G Sudharkaran last week. Sreedharan, who started the inspection from the northern end of the flyover, walked beneath the 750m flyover and conducted a detailed inspection of each pillar and girder. Alaga Sundara Murthy, professor of structural engineering laboratory at the department of civil engineering at IIT-Madras, and Mahesh Tandon from IIT-Kanpur accompanied him through the inspection. Officials from PWD, roads and bridges development corporation of Kerala limited (RBDCK) and Kitco Ltd were also present. Murthy explained to Sreedharan the findings by the IIT-Madras team, which had earlier conducted a study of the flyover and found structural flaws. He showed him the cracks on the pillars and girders which have been posing threat to the bridge’s stability. The reinforcement and restoration works of the flyover were also monitored by the team. The team reportedly raised concerns about the severe cracks on the girders. After the inspection beneath the bridge, the team went to the top of the bridge where they spent around 15 minutes to inspect the potholes and cracks. After this, Sreedharan concluded the inspection and returned to DMRC office where an internal meeting of all parties involved in the flyover construction was held. Sachin Warrier-Pooja wedding reception t.description: Singer-music composer Sachin Warrier recently got married to Pooja in Thrissur, and the wedding was followed by a fun-filled reception in Kochi on June 16. While Sachin wore a white shirt with suspenders, Pooja looked very cute in a short, baby pink dress. Unlike other wedding receptions, the couple planted a sapling, instead of cutting the cake, and their family and friends made sure that everything about the function was different. As it also happened to be Father’s Day, the newlyweds’ dads took centre stage, and Sachin and Pooja together celebrated their real life heroes. It was followed by a lot of interesting games, which kept the guests entertained. Among those who made their presence felt were actor Vineeth Sreenivasan with wife Divya and their munchkin, singer Jyotsna, Resmi Sateesh, and Anandam fame director Ganesh Raj. Muvattupuzha-Kaloor chain service launch.description: KOCHI: KSRTC has launched a chain service from its Muvattupuzha depot linking Pattimattam, Kizhakambalam and Kakkanad with Kaloor. Buses in the chain service will operate every 15 minutes bringing relief to hundreds of passengers who had to suffer hardships in the absence of proper connectivity. KSRTC has pledged 16 limited stop ordinary buses to run the service. The route is a revenue-earner for KSRTC and currently there are 40 trips every day. The number of trips have gone up to 56 with the launch of the chain service. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. DYFI meet to discuss woman\u2019s resign.description: PALAKKAD: The upcoming district committee meet of DYFI will discuss the resignation of the woman member of the youth wing, who had complained of sexual harassment against party MLA P K Sasi. The woman from Mannarkkad had complained of sexual harassment against the Shoranur MLA, following which the later was suspended from the party for six months. During the two-day camp of the DYFI on Saturday and Sunday at Elappully, the DYFI district committee was reconstituted by allegedly demoting some of the party members who had supported the woman. The complainant had tendered her resignation following the move on Sunday. T M Sasi, the new district secretary of DYFI, said the issue of resignation would be taken up in the next district committee meet. He added that the reconstitution of the committee was a normal procedure followed in the organization and it was used to promote people on merit and demote those who do not discharge their responsibilities efficiently. The woman’s complaint against the MLA, who is also a secretariat member of the party district committee, was a major embarrassment for the CPM and DYFI and there were differences within the committee as some members supported the woman and demanded stern action against the MLA. The resignation is also said to be in protest against the elevation of a DYFI leader as the district vice-president, who was accused of tarnishing the image of the woman leader through social media. The MLA was suspended for six months from the party on November 26 after an inquiry commission appointed by the party, consisting of minister A Balan and P K Sreemathi found him guilty. As the punishment period was over, the party is learned to be considering to take him back. But the fresh controversy and the humiliating defeat of the Left in the Lok Sabha polls are likely to delay his reinduction. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Withdraw cash from an ATM, slip in a not.description: KOCHI: It is a neat trick. To make a quick buck, withdraw money from an ATM using a valid debit card, then slip back a currency note into the machine and then claim refund for the entire amount from the bank. The bank would credit the money into the account, thereby almost doubling the cash in hand. Such a fraud came to light on Wednesday with the arrest of Amin Khan (42) from Alwar in Rajasthan and Riyaju Khan (27) from Palwal in Haryana, following high drama at Mattancherry. They had withdrawn Rs 10,000 from their accounts when they were caught red-handed by officials from SBI, located right next to the ATM kiosk at Kalvathy in Mattancherry, for trying to cover CCTV camera with a piece of paper at 8.53am. They fled on seeing security guards, only to be chased down by residents and guards, who overpowered and handed them over to Mattancherry police. During interrogation, they revealed their modus operandi. “For instance, if they withdraw Rs 10,000 and five Rs2000 notes are dispensed, they would slip back one currency note back in. They said that some ATMs would ‘think’ that the entire amount was being taken back,” said Mattancherry CI VS Navas. The accused would call up the bank’s helpline and complain about the debit. As a result, the entire sum would be ‘refunded’ in their account. Navas said the duo managed 13 such frauds in Thiruvananthapuram, Kochi and Tamil Nadu since June 10. The details are being compiled, said police. Sources said that though the attempt at Kalvathy failed, the accused claim they had executed one such fraud in city. Police said that a bank official had informed that this method was not possible. “The bank official told us that there is a way to switch off the ATM at the time of dispensation of cash and he suggested that the fraudsters might have used such an option. In this way they could convince the bank that notes were not dispensed owing to a system failure and demand refund,” said Navas, adding that the accused were sticking to their version. A demo with expert technicians will be held to see how exactly the fraud happens, he said. “The accused claimed that their technique works in the ATMs manufactured by a certain company. We will be interrogating the accused further to know the truth. Anyway, their accounts received money lately,” he said. Meanwhile, a senior banker, on condition of anonymity, said that fraud – as described by the accused – could be done. “This has happened before. At least, some old machines are still prone to this problem. If such a claim is made and fund is not transferred, bank would have to pay a penalty of Rs 100/day. So, most banks credit the sum right away. Once an enquiry reveals the truth, it would be too late,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Project to ensure people\u2019s role in.description: KOCHI: As part of the Indo-German bilateral cooperation, the ministry of housing and urban affairs (MoHUA) and the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) India are jointly implementing Sustainable Urban Development – Smart Cities (SUD-SC) project. The objective of the project is to support sustainable development in various Indian cities. As part of the process, Kochi municipal corporation with the support of GIZ, organized ‘Ente Kochi’ symposium here on Monday. This is to facilitate implementation of sustainable project through a holistic and integrated approach. ‘Ente Kochi’, a participatory planning initiative, involved local residents in participatory processes through an interactive public exhibition set up at the Folklore Cultural Theatre at Fort Kochi. The exhibition had been organized parallel to the Kochi-Muziris Biennale in March. ‘Ente Kochi’ participatory process also spread through the city with a series of neighbourhood workshops at different locations. These neighbourhood consultations, known as ‘Urban Typhoon’ workshops, were held at Kaloor, Edakochi, Elamkulam, Market Canal and Mattancherry in June. These were led by Mumbai-based Urbz, an experimental action and research collective, which specializes in participatory planning and designing, and has experience working in India and other international locations. At the same time, there are opinions that this programme does not have much significance in states like Kerala. “We have people’s planning programme which ensures people’s participation in designing and implementation of development projects in an effective manner. So, the initiative by GIZ has nothing more to do,” said an official with the Kochi corporation said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\n\u200b Manoj K Jayan rings in the fest.description: A handful of Malayalam celebrities recently gathered to celebrate Onam in advance. But there was more to it, as the event was organised for a noble cause, by the TV actors association, Athma. Among the audience were people affected by paraplegia. Actors Dileep, KPAC Lalitha, Manoj K Jayan and Krishna Prabha, all decked up in Kerala attire, danced and sang with the patients to give them a one -of- a -kind experience. TV host and actor Kishore Sathya and Suby Suresh were also present at the event, which saw an array of programmes. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati. No nepotism involved in appointment of m.description: KOCHI: State government has contended before the Kerala high court that there was no nepotism involved in the appointment of higher education minister KT Jaleel’s cousin KT Adeeb to a senior post in a state-run corporation. The government was responding to a petition (WP-C No. 10262/2019) filed by PK Firos of Kozhikode seeking a probe against the minister under provisions of Prevention of Corruption Act. Adeeb was appointed as general manager at Kerala State Minority Development Finance Corporation Ltd. A statement filed by minorities welfare department through state attorney KV Sohan said, “There is no corruption, favouritism, nepotism or illegality in the matter of appointment of Sri. Adeeb KT. There is absolutely no undue advantage obtained by the minister or anybody else before or after the appointment in issue.” Notification for the job opening was published in Chandrika, Madhyamam, and Deshabhimani dailies on August 27, 2016. Though another applicant, Saheer Kaladi, was invited for the interview on October 26, 2016, he did not attend the interview. While the qualification prescribed was MBA in marketing or finance or CS/CA/ICWAI with 3 years experience, MBA (HR) and BTech with PGDBA was also included on August 25, 2016. As Adeeb had the required qualification, he was appointed following recommendation to the government by the company’s board on September 11, 2018. An NOC was obtained from assistant general manager of South Indian Bank, where Adeeb was working. Adeeb later requested to be relieved and the corporation’s board requested the government to relieve him on November 13, 2018 and it was accepted on November 16, government said in the statement. The row over the appointment had surfaced early in November 2018. Government also informed the court that there was nothing wrong in Adeeb requesting annual incentive bonus and other allowances. Only an unsigned complaint was submitted before Vigilance and Anti-Corruption Bureau by email on November 3rd and the government concluded that there is no necessity of conducting an enquiry. Kerala's Alappuzha municipality is givin.description: ALAPPUZHA: Alappuzha municipality's 'Thinkal' project is getting good response .As part of the project, the municipality is giving 5000 menstrual cups free of cost to women in a bid to curb the growing problem of menstrual waste.  Alapppuzha municipal secretary S Jahamgeer said that the municipality that kicked off the project on Saturday is now daily distributing 500 menstrual cups and daily the distribution finishing by mid of the day. "We have stored 5000 menstrual cups. But daily we are distributing only 500. Otherwise, people will misuse, and even medical store people may come and buy it. We are distributing it from the front office of the municipality and Kudumbashree office at Kaichoondimukku. Any woman can buy it after presenting an ID card and they should register their names in any of these two offices with the phone number. Then they will get menstrual cup of Rs 600. It can be reused for a period of up to five years. The demand for the cup is increasing. So we will daily distribute more than 500 cups," he said. "This is the first phase of this project and under this, 5,000 menstrual cups will be given. This project is being executed as a means for the effective waste management system. This one cup can replace as many as 780 sanitary napkins. So through 5,000 cups, we are preventing 39 lakh sanitary napkins which will come as the waste after it use. Under second phase of the project, we will give reusable pads made of clothes," he said. This project is being executed by Alappuzha municipality in association with the Hindustan Latex Limited. It is funded under the Corporate Social Responsibility initiative of the Coal India Limited. Finance minister T M Thomas Isaac inaugurated this project. Alappuzha municipality has already received global attention for its effective waste management system. Alappuzha was among five cities of the world whose projects to end the problem of solid waste have been recognised as success stories by the United Nations environment body UNEP. A new platform for documentary makers.description: Documentary Filmmakers Forum of Kerala (DFFK), a forum that brings together the state's documentary movie makers, was launched in the capital city recently. It was inaugurated by veteran filmmaker Adoor Gopalakrishnan at Press Club, Thiruvananthapuram. The new venture promises to support and coordinate special workshops and activities that will help the growth of documentary making in the state. We spotted PRD Deputy Director Salin Mankuzhy, Chalachithra Akademi Secretary Mahesh Panju, Bharath Bhavan member secretary Pramod Payyanur and Noorunad Ramachandran at the venue. The event also honoured many prominent documentary makers in the state including Walter D’Cruz, who was bestowed with the Kerala State Film Award for the Best Documentary of 2018. Photo courtesy: Satheeshan Karicheri In Video:DFFK inauguratedDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

KSEB to sign power purchase pact with pr.description: KOCHI: The KSEB’s decision to sign power purchase agreement (PPA) with GJ Eco Power Private Limited, which is the private partner of Kochi corporation in constructing Waste to Energy (WtE) plant at Brahmapuram, has kickstarted a row. According to those opposing the sudden decision to sign the PPA, it is unfair from the part of authorities to sign such an agreement when the project has not even received the crucial Environment Impact Assessment (EIA) clearance. As per a communique from KSEB, the power utility will sign the PPA with the private firm in Thiruvananthapuram on Tuesday. “The PPA should be signed only after the project gets EIA nod. We don’t understand why KSEB is signing the agreement in a hurry,” said Kerala electricity workers federation state secretary Jacob Lazar. “There are many instances in which the KSEB ended up making losses after signing such agreements without considering the consequences. KSEB is still paying fixed charges to National Thermal Power Corporation (NTPC) though the agency has stopped purchasing power from the Kayamkulam plant. As per the agreement with NTPC, KSEB should pay fixed charges even if it doesn’t purchase electricity from the firm. Similarly, KSEB had to pay fixed charges to a private firm at Eloor despite no electricity was purchased from them,” Lazar said. According to experts in the field of energy and zero waste system, the agreement is being signed in a hurry only to protect the vested interests of certain officials. “The undue haste shown in signing the PPA points to the possibilities of corruption. Breaching the laws first and then getting it rectified has become an order of the day, especially in the case of the state government,” said Zero Waste Systems consultant Shibu K N. “Some of the top officials are behind the move. Their aim is to constitute a waste to energy management authority and place themselves at the top of the body,” Shibu said. Meanwhile, officials with GJ Eco Power Private Limited said the decision to sign the PPA was taken before the general elections. “Just a formal signing of the agreement is happening on Tuesday. There is nothing illegal or unfair in this,” said an official with the firm. “The project would soon get EIA clearance. We have completed the public hearing as part of the EIA clearance. Now, we will be sending the details of the public hearing, including the audio and video clips, to the State Environment Impact Assessment Authority (SEIAA),” the official said. He also said that approvals from other agencies like Pollution Control Board (PCB) had been secured. “So, the work on the project can be started after securing EIA clearance,” he said. Overseas investment for Kerala's develop.description: KOCHI: A petition filed before the Kerala high court questioning the constitutional validity of Masala Bonds to secure investment from overseas has been withdrawn by the petitioner. The petition (WP-C No. 16711/2019) was filed by Ranjit Karthikeyan of Vanchiyoor in Thiruvananthapuram, who is a chartered accountant, by alleging that the steps taken for issuing the bonds under Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Act of 1999 violates Article 293(1), which stipulates that state governments are allowed to borrow only within the country. A counsel representing the petitioner sought to withdraw the petition after a division bench comprising chief justice Hrishikesh Roy and justice AK Jayasankaran Nambiar pointed out that the investment is being canvassed not by the state government but by Kerala Infrastructure Investment Board (KIIB). The petitioner has no case that security offered is against the consolidated fund of the state, the court said. While withdrawing the plea, the counsel also sought permission to file a fresh one, if so advised, after collecting necessary information. While dismissing the case as not pressed, the court has reserved the liberty of the petitioner to approach the court again. It was contended by the petitioner that KIIB is a statutory body and a ‘State’ and is therefore bound by Article 293(1). A plain reading of the article makes it clear that KIIB violated it by issuing rupee-denominated bonds to overseas investors. Executive power of the state extends to borrowings only within India and borrowing from overseas investors, even in rupee-denominated bonds, has not been envisaged or provided for by the Constitution, the petition had stated. Issuing of Masala Bonds to overseas investors is illegal, arbitrary, and unreasonable and violates Article 14 (equality before law), 19 (right to freedom), and 21 (right to life and liberty) of the Constitution, the petitioner had argued while stating that any act of the government must be reasonable and should be towards public interest. The high rate of interest of 9.723% puts a burden on the public exchequer, thus compromising public interest, it was alleged. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Apartment owners allege 1996 CRZ map was.description: KOCHI: Residents of Alfa Serene apartment, facing the threat of demolition, have said that the 1996 Coastal Zone Mapping (CZMP), on the basis of which the property in which they reside has been deemed illegal, was crude, inaccurate and full of errors. The Supreme Court had on May 8 ordered the demolition of the four high rises at Maradu, including Alfa Serene, citing the violation of coastal regulation zone (CRZ) norms. Addressing a news meet here, Alfa Serene Apartment Owners’ Association said the 1996 map was so crude that it was difficult to identify a place. “It is unlike the map prepared in 2012 by Maradu municipality, in which the building and CR zones can be clearly identified by the survey numbers,” said association president Rasheed Usman. The press conference was also attended by association secretary Sen Eapen and Sooraj Krishna, a resident. “It mentioned that the area comes under CRZ-3, which is defined as relatively undisturbed rural area. But the area in which the apartment is located is more developed than some of the Cochin corporation areas,” said Krishna. “In 2003 itself the Kerala high court had said that the 1996 map is basic and so illegible that no definite conclusions can be made with such mapping,” he said. “What is the minimum guarantee for people like us? We relied on the approval documents given to us by the builder and the due diligence done by the banks who have given loans. The sub-registrar office collected the stamp duty paid by us, the municipality collected building tax from us, the village office collected land tax from us, KSEB is collecting charges for electricity, oil companies are collecting LPG charges, Kerala Water Authority is collecting water charges from us. So, we have been living in this community as legitimate owners,” said Krishna. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Court stays Jose\u2019s elevation as cha.description: IDUKKI: Thodupuzha munsiff court has stayed the election of Jose K Mani as the chairman of the Kerala Congress (Mani) on Monday. The court refrained Jose from officiating the duty of the party chairman and holding the elections in the party, said the counsel of KC (M) state committee members Philip Stephen and Manohar Naduvilethu who petitioned against Jose. The order is not out yet. Jose was elected in a state committee meet held in Kottayam on Sunday. Meanwhile, Jose arrived at the party headquarters in Kottayam by evening. The name board of K M Mani outside the room of the chairman was removed and a new board with Jose 's name was fixed. Jose spent some time in the chairman's room. Before leaving he told reporters that he did not receive a copy of the order. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kerala state lottery Sthree Sakthi SS-16.description: NEW DELHI: The Kerala lottery department will announce the results of Sthree Sakthi SS-162 lottery on Tuesday. The results will be available on Kerala lottery department's official website. The live results will be out at 3pm while the full results will be available from 4pm onwards. The first prize is of Rs 60 lakh, the second prize is of Rs 50 lakh while the third is of Rs 5,000. There is a consolation prize of Rs 8,000. The lottery draw will be conducted by Kerala lottery department at Sree Chithra Home Auditorium. The price of a single lottery ticket is Rs 30. The prize winners are advised to verify the winning numbers with the Kerala lottery results, published in the Kerala Government Gazette, and surrender the winning tickets within 30 days. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Uttar Pradesh.description: "You're sitting on my grand mother's grave," Salim Shah told this correspondent. She has been buried, he said, in his living room. A clutch of houses in Chah Pokhar in Achnera block of Agra have turned into graveyards as families are forced to bury their departed in their homes due to lack of a burial ground. As a result, the dead here are a constant part of day-to-day life. TOI found women cooking next to where their children were buried while the elderly rested on cots in a backyard full of graves. In one of the houses, Rinki Begum told TOI that five bodies were buried in her backyard, including that of her 10-month-old son who had died of an untreated fever. Another resident, Guddi, said, "For poor people like us, there is no dignity in death. Due to lack of space in houses, people have to sit and walk over graves. It is so disrespectful." Almost all the houses in the block have graves within the compound Most of the Muslim families here are poor and landless and men scout for work as contract labourers. They said their demand for a graveyard has been ignored for years. The pond in Chah Pokhar village, where a piece of land is allocated for the burial ground on papersThe apathy of the administration can be gauged from the fact that a plot allotted for a graveyard some years ago falls right in the middle of a pond. Repeated complaints have fallen on deaf ears and residents are running out of space. The fresh graves are no more cemented to ensure they occupy less space and stones of different sizes kept over them are the only way to tell them apart. Protests have erupted in the past over the issue. In 2017, after the death of resident Mangal Khan, his family refused to bury his body until land for a graveyard was provided in the village. After assurances by the authorities, they buried Khan near the pond. But the promises came to nothing. Living with the dead: A grave in the backyard"All we are asking for is some land for our ancestors. There is a cremation ground for the Hindus in the periphery of the village, but we are living with our dead," said Munim Khan, a factory worker. Desperate residents even tried reaching out to nearby Sanan village and Achnera town that have burial grounds. But they were not willing to part with precious space. "These two villages have a larger Muslim population than Chah Pokhar. Their burial grounds are filled to capacity," said Nizam Khan, a mechanic. Village pradhan Sundar Kumar said that he had asked officials several times for a burial ground for Muslim families, but no action was taken. Ravi Kumar NG, the district magistrate, said that he was not aware of the issue. "I will send an official team to the village and get details of the burial land required." Picture Credit: Hemant Kumar In Video:Houses turn into graveyards as Muslims in this UP village bury the dead at homeDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

2 held for ATM fraud in Kochi.description: KOCHI: In a case of suspected ATM fraud, two persons were taken into custody by Mattancherry police after a guard saw them sticking a piece of paper around a CCTV camera. The accused, who tried to flee after the guard raised an alarm, were caught by local residents. The incident happened at a SBI ATM kiosk at Kalvathy, Mattancherry. Cops are interrogating the accused for more details. The accused told the police that they used to withdraw money from ATMs and keep one currency note back at the slot from where the currency is dispensed after which the machine gets jammed. The accused then used to lodge a complaint at the helpline number about the machine being jammed and hence would get a refund of the whole amount withdrawn. Police said that similar frauds have been reported in the past after which some ATMs were modified. They are probing if the method has again become possible. "As of now, our information is based on the statement of the accused. More details on how they executed the fraud and how many times they have done it in the past can only be known after a probe," said a senior police officer with Mattacherry police. Cops are yet to reveal the names of the accused as their arrests have not been recorded yet. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Call records doctored, say defence lawye.description: KOTTAYAM: Defence lawyers questioned the authenticity of the telephonic conversations presented by the prosecution in the ongoing trial in the Kevin P Joseph murder case at the principal session court here on Wednesday. The lawyers tried to establish that reports from forensic labs were contradictory. But investigating officer denied the allegations. Kevin Joseph: Married on Friday, murdered on SundayThe defence lawyers also argued that the records of phone conversation between first accused Shyanu Chacko and ASI Biju were doctored. The prosecution has been alleging that Shyanu spoke about murdering Kevin during the calls. But all the phone calls between them were not examined, they said, adding that the prosecution has stated that Shyanu chatted with someone whose contact name was saved as ‘Pappa Kuwait’. That person’s phone has not been examined, the defence lawyers argued. Kevin P Joseph was alive as he ‘fell’ into riverThe defence lawyers also questioned the authenticity of the CCTV visuals. The forensic lab officials initially said that they cannot examine the footage by separating each visual. Later, they said they can do it. The prosecution has submitted the CCTV visuals as proof of the presence of the accused persons in Mannanam. Forensic lab submitted the new report in the court only after the trial started, they said. The defence lawyers have been arguing that the prosecution could not prove beyond suspicion that Kevin was murdered. An accused can’t be punished based on assumptions, they said. However, the investigating officer told the court that the evidence submitted before court were correct and clear. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Club members express shock.description: KOCHI: Members of the Lotus Club are in a state of shock as the district collector has issued an order to recover the land occupied by the club. The historically-important club came into beingdue the effort of Sir Robert Bristow, the architect of willingdon island. It was in 1931, the Lotus Club was established and the members still maintain discipline and culture inculcated by the founders. “Till then, Cochin Club was the club for elite in the area. When Bristow’s wife approached the club authorities for membership, they turned down her request. After this, Bristow visited the king of Kochi and requested for allotting land for constructing a new club. The king granted his plea and Lotus Club was set up in the land thus given by the ruler of erstwhile Kochi kingdom,” said Suresh Raj, a member of the club.  “Lotus Club has a history and it should be protected. The rules, culture and discipline introduced by the founders are being followed by the members even today,” said Raj said. The club conducts annual billiards and snooker tournaments, besides conducting tennis camps. Library, badminton and other sports facilities are other attractions of the club. “Many renowned personalities, including kings of erstwhile kingdom of Kochi, had associated with the club. They visited the club regularly. Even now, stalwarts from different walks of life frequent the club,” said Manoj Padmanabhan, another member of the club. The club has a membership of around 1,500, including women. “Lotus Club is a family club. An qual number of memberships are given to women as well,” Raj said. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The results will be available on Kerala lottery department's official website. The live results will be out at 3pm while the full results will be available from 4pm onwards. Chellanam residents protest by locking p.description: KOCHI: Irked by the frequent sea erosion and authorities’ failure in finding comprehensive solution to the issue, Chellanam residents staged a protest at the panchayat office after locking the office from outside on Monday. More than 800 protesters staged a dharna in front of the office demanding a comprehensive solution to the problems caused by sea erosion. Even though the panchayat officials waited till 2pm to enter the office, the protesters did not let them in. Following this, the officials had to return and the office remained shut for the rest of the day even after the protesters dispersed. According to Kannamali police, around 700 people marched from Velankanni church to the office around 10am but were blocked by the police before they could enter the office compound. But the protesters, who anticipated the police move, had sent around 50 women to the office around 8am and they locked the office’s main door from outside. The protest led by West Kochi Theera Samrakshana Samithi put forward a slew of demands which they wanted to be implemented by the government on a war footing. “We demand the government to complete the seawall work after announcing a deadline. We want the government to construct a groyne along Chellanam coast at the earliest. A vigilance probe has to be initiated into the geotube project. Above all, the government should launch a relief package to reconstruct damaged houses,” said Samithi convener T A Dalphin. Chellanam panchayat president Mercy Joshy said they had apprised the government about the problems through K J Maxi, MLA. Kannamali police registered cases against the protesters for unlawful assembly and blocking road for hours. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Degree Show\u201919 gets a new space.description: The artwork of the students of the College of Fine Arts Thiruvananthapuram no longer need to just vie for space in their classroom. They now get to exhibit them at the new spacious art gallery building inside their college premises. The occasion was their Degree Show ’19 and on display were the prominent art and installation works of students of the recent batches from the college. Communicating various subjects and ideas, the art pieces was a visual treat. The week-long show which kicked off on June 14 also included talks by eminent personalities from the field of art. We saw film critic C S Venkiteswaran talking to young artists on contemporary art. Three generations of alumni come togethe.description: Clad in a saffron sari adorned with rudraksha ornaments, the member of the erstwhile Travancore royal family, Pooyam Tirunal Gouri Parvathi Bayi represented a sage on stage. She was one of the 87 performers at the alumni event organised by the Old Students Association (OSA) of the Government Women’s College, Thiruvananthapuram. Titled Vasthrayana, the dance drama themed on the evolution of garments in India was a visual treat for those in attendance at the Karthika Tirunal Auditorium, recently. The cultural extravaganza saw performances of three generations of students, from the previous pre-degree batches to the recent graduates. Hundreds of alumni including homemakers, working professionals, artistes and bureaucrats, joined the performers at the venue to take a stroll down memory lane to relive their campus life. While those who had become great grandmothers enjoyed watching the show, many were looking around for their old batchmates. Though time had changed their physical appearance, many still found their pals, by calling out their nicknames. Singer Kanchana Sreeram, BA Music graduate of the 2017 batch, portrayed a South Indian bride on the show and says the event gave her friendship goals. “At a time when video calls and group chats are the norm, this alumni group stands apart because the reunion is held regularly without fail. I am happy I could see our super seniors and their seniors still joke around like in their younger days. I think they were the most enthusiast bunch at the event,” she says. “I was also surprised to see the performance of Princess Gouri Parvathi Bhayi, who danced flawlessly.” The dance drama narrated the evolution of garments with time — from the stone age to contemporary dressing styles. The event was held under the guidance of Pooyam Tirunal Gouri Parvathi Bayi, who is the OSA secretary. “The show is held every two years. The 87 members who were part of this show were of different ages and from all walks of life. We had grandmothers and mothers alongside granddaughters and daughters. It was hard work but fun too. Our dance director Aswathy Nair worked tirelessly to ensure seamless production and Ambili Ramnath’s expertise with words and Kavalam Sreekumar’s magic with the music have always been the mainstay of our performances,” she says. Apart from performing, for Gouri Parvathi Bayi, it is also an event to meet her friends and teachers. “I have never really left the Women’s College - as a student, teacher and as part of the Alumni association, I have always remained in touch with the institution. For most of us, there is a sense of homecoming when we step into the college compound. The years fall away, and we feel rejuvenated. Ultimately in life, our real earnings are the friendships we have forged, the wonderful experiences nobody can take away from us and precious memories that stay with us always. Many of our older members make it a point to come to our meetings and events. They make a greater physical effort than youngsters who work a full day and have homes to run too,” she adds. Actress Sona Nair was also part of the event, enthralling her friends in her avatar as goddess Saraswati. “This is an event that I eagerly look forward to. I feel blessed meeting my old teachers and classmates, and giving me memories to cherish for the next two years. Each of the 87 artistes were given a three-and-half-minute performance and so that ensured everyone had equal time to perform,” she says, adding that she always makes it a point to find time amid her shooting schedules to make it to the reunion. Photo Courtesy: Satheeshan Karicheri In Video:Three generations of alumni come together for a memorable bashDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Extraordinary gazette now online.description: KOCHI: For long, anyone who wanted to access the extraordinary gazette, which could be published on any day of the week by the printing and stationary department, as per the demand of various government departments, there was no other option than to visit the libraries of handful of institutions which subscribed and stored them. The situation has changed as the extraordinary gazette notifications are now available online. Advocates and government officials who needed a copy of the notifications had to make a trip to the high court, office of the advocate general, assembly secretariat or the state central library. A copy of the gazette would also be with the government departments which publish them. That was it. While the state’s ordinary gazette, a public journal and an authorized legal document published every week by the department of printing and stationary, is available online from 2007 onwards, the publishing of extraordinary gazette to online space marks a significant shift in government approach. Officials and judiciary depend a lot on extraordinary gazette notifications and now they will have them at their fingertips as certified digital documents with legal validity. Jacob George, a faculty with National University of Advanced Legal Studies who had campaigned for such a facility, said this would be of immense use to legal fraternity. “It was hard to find extraordinary gazette notifications all at one place. While there are some teething issues this would be beneficial as it would increase the transparency,” he said. Printing department director Muraleedharan said government departments would be able to directly upload templates of the required notification, which would be published online with digital signatures. “Page length of extraordinary gazette may vary from one to many. It used to be printed as required,” he said. They would be published exclusively online henceforth. Sources in the department said the ordinary gazette currently available at egazette.kerala.gov.in does not have legal validity. The ordinary gazette would also shift to a similar mode when all digital publishing modules are launched in another two months. While the extraordinary gazette has no bearing on general public, once the ordinary gazette notifications became available online as certified documents, public would benefit from it. Vagamon gets a Rs 99lakh worth facelift.description: Idukki: In a bid to attract more tourists to Vagamon, the tourism department has completed infrastructure works estimated at Rs 99 lakh in the hill station. The works gave a facelift to the destination, said Idukki District Tourism Promotion Council secretary (DTPC) Jayan P Vijayan. The works covered entrance gate, tourism information centre, ticket counter, lifted stone-laid walkway with flowering plants on either side, benches, toilets, rest rooms, censors, LED lightings and waste bins. “The construction works were entrusted with central government agency Vapcos. A garden close to the lake and a children park will be constructed in Vagamon in the second phase of the tourism project,” Jayan said. “The new facilities will be inaugurated during the monsoon tourist season. As many as five lakh tourists visited Vagamon in last year. Nearly 1.5 lakh tourists reached Vagamon during the monsoon last year. The heavy tourist inflow shows Vagamon have a vast tourism potential,” Vijayan said. Para gliding, pine plantation, evergreen meadows are the main attractions in Vagamon. It is a favourite to the tourists for its vast view of the hills from the open space and chilly weather in any season. Vagamon is considered as the third main tourism destination in Idukki. “We hope the new infrastructure works will attract more tourists to the destination. The wide parking area form part of the new infrastructure will be the additional attraction in the destination,” Jayan said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

IS module in Tamil Nadu has links with K.description: KOZHIKODE: The Islamic State (IS) module in Coimbatore that was busted by the National Investigation Agency (NIA) last week has close links with Malayali terror groups, it is learnt. The statement given to security agencies in December 2018 by a Keralite, who was deported from Qatar for suspected terror links in 2015, says that some of those arrested by the NIA in Coimbatore regularly interacted with their Kerala counterparts. The Malayali, who hails from Palakkad, was deported from Qatar for allegedly trying to migrate to Syria to join Jabhat Al-Nusra, a terror outfit, in 2013. The NIA had in January 2019 registered a case against a group of youths for alleged terror links. The youth in question is among this ‘group’ and is currently under surveillance. He is likely to turn approver, it is learnt. He had told his interrogators earlier that one of the accused in the Coimbatore case was his Facebook friend. He had added that 30 persons, including Malayalis, were members of a WhatsApp group created by the Coimbatore module. The Malayali had said that, during a visit to India in 2014, he had visited Coimbatore to meet the members of the IS module there. Members from various muslim outfits petitioned Coimbatore Police Comissioner related to NIA search in Ukkadam.After deportation in 2015, he again met some of the members of the Coimbatore module and handed over money to them, who in return handed over copies of a book they published. According to him, the Al-Nusra module in Qatar included Thaha Muhammad, a Karnataka-native born and brought up in Qatar; Sultan, hailing from Kozhikode; Rijaz Aboobacker, Thrissur native but settled in Qatar; Irafan, a native of Mahe and Siddique, hailing from Kozhikode. They were radicalized by one Hashir, a native of Paravoor, who was already radicalized through the speeches Anwar Al-Awlaki, the Salafi preacher who was killed in a US drone attack in Afghanistan and Abdulla Yusuf Azzam, one of the founding members of Al Qaeda. Some in the group left for Syria via Turkey to join Al-Nusra but two of them had returned to India. Hashir and Irfan, who arrived in Syria, used to regularly contact those who did not migrate and had sent photographs from that country. The Kerala Al Nusra group had contacts with Yahya alias Bestin and Easa alias Bexton, the natives of Palakkad who migrated to the Islamic State strongholds in Afghanistan. Shias, the youth from Kasaragod who migrated to Afghanistan, was also a part of the gang. Abdul Rashid Abdulla, the leader of the Kerala IS module, also maintained contacts with the group. The statement by the Malayali confirmed the suspicion that Keralites had migrated to Syria even before the official formation of the Islamic State in 2014. There were reports that one Abu Tahir, a native of Palakkad who had gone to Syria in 2013, was killed in battle. He also had joined Al Nusra, the splinter organisation of the Al Qaeda formed in 2012 to fight the Syrian government. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
