District collector issues order to recov.description: KOCHI: District collector K Mohammed Y Safirulla passed an order on Wednesday, upholding the order of the additional tahsildar of Kanayannur to take back 82.250 cents occupied by Lotus Club, stating that the club had failed to furnish documents to prove its ownership. He issued the order after hearing an appeal filed by office-bearers of the club, challenging the orders issued by the additional tahsildar and Fort Kochi’s subcollector to recover the said land on Warriam Road. In an order issued on February 2, 2010 under Kerala Land Conservancy Act, the additional tahsildar said that the club has occupied puramboke land as per revenue records. Since it exists on encroached land, it should be vacated. The club secured a stay on the order and approached the Ernakulam sub court and filed a revision petition before revenue authorities citing that the land was given by the king of erstwhile kingdom of Kochi. But, nothing went in their favour. Club authorities then approached Fort Kochi subcollector, who is the appellate authority, to challenge the order. But the sub-collector—in his order in April 2018 — upheld the order of the additional tahsildar. As per the basic tax register and puramboke register, 80.25 cents in the survey number 740/2 of Ernakulam village in Kanayannur taluk is government land and it was encroached by the club, the sub-collector said. Then, the club moved the high court which ordered the district collector to hear the review petition filed by the club and issue an appropriate order. Based on the court order, Safirulla considered the matter and found that the club lacked documents to prove the ownership of the land. The club claimed that the erstwhile kingdom had even granted timber for the construction of the club house. “I haven’t seen the order issued by the district collector. So, I don’t want to comment on the issue. The land was given to us by the Maharaja of Kochi and the club began in 1931. We rebuilt the structure in 70s and government and local body gave us all necessary approvals,” said secretary of the club Joseph Kurian Pooppally, when the collector’s order was brought to his notice. Thiruvananthapuram commissioner has no c.description: KOCHI: Thiruvananthapuram city police commissioner's report that election to police cooperative society would result in violence shows he lacks control over policemen, says the Kerala High Court. The court has now sought the views of state police chief in the matter. The possibility of violence between police personnel was highlighted by the commissioner in a letter sent to Kerala State Cooperative Election Commission. After perusing the letter, justice Devan Ramachandran said in an interim order, "I must say that the contents of this letter make very disquieting reading. This is because, this is a society of Civil Police Officers and a responsible Commissioner of Police says that the members of the society are likely to be at war with each other physically, leading to 'major law and order issues'. The irony is that this is stated by the Commissioner of Police against Civil Police Officers, clearly indicating that he has little control over rank and file." After making state police chief a party in the case suo motu, the court has asked him to inform views about the police commissioners allegations by Friday. A petition filed by P Prathapachandran through senior advocate George Poonthottam is being considered by the court. Postponement of election to Police Cooperative Society Ltd was sought by the petitioner as local elections are to be held on the dance day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Removing unauthorized boards: HC orders.description: KOCHI: The Kerala High Court has ordered Kottayam district police chief to conduct a probe into alleged illegal detention of Kottayam municipality secretary by union leaders of MG University for removing flex boards of university festival. Justice Devan Ramachandran ordered the district police chief to launch an investigation after considering a letter petition stating that the municipality secretary J Muhammed Shafi was unlawfully detained for about an hour by a gang of eight persons who claimed to be union leaders of MG University by trespassing into his official residence. The gang had allegedly detained him without allowing him to make any phone calls and had attacked the health squad of the municipality that reached his residence then. It was demanded by the gang that the municipal secretary should reinstall the unauthorized boards put up in connection with the university festival and the boards were forcefully taken from the secretary’s custody and reinstalled by the gang in different parts of the town, the letter received at the high court said. On February 26th last year, the high court had issued a common order directing secretaries of local self-government institutions to remove all unauthorized flex boards, advertisement boards, banners, flag, and hoardings in public spaces and streets in the state. The order had also asked district collectors to inspect the territory under their jurisdiction and initiate action and also directed the state police chief to ensure that all station house officers are instructed to register cases against entities and persons who erect unauthorized boards, banners, flags, and hoardings. Maradu councillors blame KWA for damaged.description: TRIPUNITHURA: Upset over the frequent digging of roads by the Kerala Water Authority (KWA) to lay pipelines, the councillors of Maradu municipality, led by chairperson T H Nadeera, gheraoed the office of KWA assistant engineer on Wednesday. The protesting councillors were later arrested by the Hill Palace police. The UDF-ruled Maradu municipality was upset that the KWA was repairing roads only in the wards represented by LDF councillors. “At a special meeting on May 6, M Swaraj, MLA, had promised a sum of Rs 2.83 crore for restoration of municipal roads damaged due to KWA pipe laying works. However, the KWA behaved in a partisan manner and started road repair works in the wards represented by LDF councillors,” said Nadeera. “With the onset of monsoon, majority of the municipal roads have become unmotorable,” said municipality vice-chairman Boban Nedumparambil. They now plan to take up the matter with the water resources minister. Councillors stage protest against water shortageCouncillors of Cheranalloor panchayat on Wednesday protested in front of the Kerala Water Authority office as the area faces shortage of drinking water supply. Councillors said residents in the area have been relying on tanker trucks for the past 12 days for drinking water as the KWA failed to pump water to the area. Around eight UDF councillors laid siege to the superintendent engineer of KWA in Ernakulam demanding to increase the time of pumping from Aluva. “If officials increase the rate of pumping, residents in the panchayat will get water,” said ward member Raju C K. The siege ended after officials promised that residents would get water from Friday onwards. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. \nBhama's attire at Lalu Alex's son's we.description: Lalu Alex’s son Ben Alex’s wedding pictures at a register office had flooded the internet recently. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Geotube contractor to move HC.description: KOCHI: The geotube project along Chellanam coast is becoming more controversial as the contractor of the project is about to approach the high court challenging the irrigation department’s decision to terminate the contract. The contractor alleged that the procurement of sand for filling the geotubes was not the part of contract that was entered with the department. “It is the responsibility of the irrigation department to provide the necessary permissions, locate sand and avail sand. The department failed in this, which led to stoppage of the work,” said the contractor. “Irrigation department officials are passing the buck to hide their mistakes. As we had mobilized the manpower, machineries, equipment and geotube materials at site after receiving work order from the department on September 10, 2018, we faced loss of time and money. The scarcity of sand was intimated to the irrigation department several times and dredging is not possible from sea near to the site due to the silt and clay accumulated in the sea up to a greater depth. Availing sand is the prime responsibility of tender issuing department, but now they say that it is the responsibility of the contractor to source sand from anywhere,” said K P Shajeel, supervisor of the project and staff of contractor Mohammed Niyas. Meanwhile, irrigation department executive engineer K Radhakrishnan said that sand was available in the sea and had to be dredged out by the contractor. “The contractor lacks the equipment to dredge out the sand and it is affecting the work which need to be completed at a fast pace. As he failed to meet the tender condition, the department had to initiate termination of contract,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Soumya murder: Magistrate records statem.description: ALAPPUZHA: Alappuzha judicial first class magistrate has recorded the statement of civil police officer (CPO) N A Ajas, who brutally murdered woman CPO Soumya Pushpakaran by setting her ablaze. The magistrate recorded his statement after Ajas told the doctor that he can speak to the magistrate on Sunday. “Ajas is undergoing treatment at Alappuzha Medical College Hospital and his burn injuries are serious. The burn injuries have affected the functioning of kidneys. The doctors started dialysis on Monday,” police said. However, Vallikunnam police are yet to register his arrest. According to police sources, Ajas said that he killed Soumya after she refused to marry him and she kept a distance from him. Meanwhile, Soumya’s relatives said that her cremation will be held by Wednesday noon. Her body is kept in the morgue of a private hospital at her native place at Oachira in Kollam. Her husband Sajeev, who is working in Libya, will reach home by Wednesday morning, a relative said. However, another relative of Soumya said that some MGNREGA workers who were at work near Soumya’s home had told them that it was not just Ajas in the car. “They told us that one more person was inside the car and he ran away when Ajas alighted from the vehicle. We have informed police about this and the police said that they need to check the CCTV footage to confirm it,” he said. Ajas, who was waiting in a rented car, in front of Soumya’s home, rammed her scooter and knocked her down on Saturday. Seeing Ajas alight from the car, Soumya tried to flee but Ajas attacked her with a sword. Soumya managed to run to a neighbour’s house after crossing a small canal. Ajas chased her, poured petrol over her body and set her on fire using a cigarette lighter. Soumya was the younger daughter of Pushpakaran and Indira of Clappana in Kollam. Pushpakaran, 67, suffered stroke four years ago and is now not able to go for work. Indira, a tailor by profession, met the study expenses of Soumya, a graduate, and her elder sister. Soumya’s elder sister and family live in Abu Dhabi. Soumya had joined Kerala Police in 2014. She was trained under Ajas for around three months. They went on to become friends through social media, said her friends. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Erotica is no longer taboo for some Mala.description: It is a rainy, cool day outside. But inside the hall at a trendy restaurant in Kochi, the atmosphere is heating up with talk of sex. It is a poetry evening, called Un-taboo, and a mixed crowd is talking about their bodies, love, loss, sexuality and abuse. “’Steady girl, take it slow’,” starts Sumi Thomas, as she reads her poem on lovemaking. “... ‘A little part of me laughs at the nerd that I am, the rest of me is burning with desire and cares not for correctness.’” Even if it is a small group which has pre-registered for the event, it is stunning to see that the wife and mother of two, albeit a media professional, doesn’t mince or hold back her words and builds up her poem to a sexual and emotional crescendo. And a few others follow suit, attracting applause and drawn breaths in a couple of cases with the boldness of their words. Are women in conservative Kerala okay with expressing their feelings on their bodies and about sex openly? Sumi says, “I know this poem is not exactly Kamala Das, but I posted it online because I felt I had to let out my voice for myself and my daughters.” Anna Varghese Puthuran, a High Court lawyer who has worked with an NGO that works with building a new life for sexually abused women and children, says, “I feel women need to reclaim spaces. This conversation has to be had. For how long can we run away from topics like this? I was always told off for writing explicitly and was told to write about pretty things, but it is important to go back to your authentic self whatever that might be. And maybe people are also more ready to accept women’s voices now.” And if they are not, don’t feel bogged down by judgment, the women say. Lola hails from Kumbalam, a village on the backwaters of Kochi, but is today a globe-trotting artist. An exhibition she is planning this year in Kochi has vagina as its theme. The artist, who “loves to draw and take pictures of nudes”, says the worst comments come from people close to her family, but she gets about 30 messages every day from strangers admiring her work. But, even for an artist who posts pictures of herself in very revealing clothes on social media, there is a self-monitoring that takes place. “Some days I’m brave and some days I’m not, but some posts can be an inspiration for others. If I’m craving to do this so much, other women must be too; so why restrict their voices?” she asks. As for her exhibition, she says Kochi is ready for it, because “it’s not sexual, it’s art”.  Sumi, who is now writing a short story ‘with a lot of erotic elements’, says, “If people judge my character based on what I write, it does not matter to me. All writing comes from some connection you feel to the stories that you are telling. I will write what I feel like writing.” Lidiya Prasad, a copywriter, who moved to Kochi from Bengaluru, felt life here would be staid and culturally low-key, so she was happy to take part in an earlier adult poetry session. She recently published a book of her “very explicit and more low-key” poems, and says, “It is not about rebelling, but people have to think of women beyond the good-girl and virgin labels. But funnily enough, though there are poems in my book which deals with other subjects, people only want to talk about the erotic stuff.”  Women feel that there are inevitably several men who felt their words were an “invitation to casual sex”. “Initially, I used to cry thinking I invited this behaviour from men, but now I’ve learnt that it is a problem they must deal with,” says Lidiya.  Their families are a mix of understanding, encouraging and embarrassed. While the women are sometimes conscious that they must not post things that would embarrass their families, Anna says, “Our relationships with our family get more mature as we age, and they become more respectful of our voice.”  Jayakrishnan Pillai, whose media company organised the Un-taboo event, which was advertised on social media, says he received a call from an elderly man in Kozhikode congratulating them for holding the event, which he said was much-needed in our society. “This poetry event was a solution to the whole idea that women cannot express themselves freely on social media without attracting sexual and annoying comments from people. This was a chance to meet like-minded people and share thoughts without being questioned,” he says. Apart from social media blurring the borders on what privacy mean, even a movement like the Kudumbashree has given women the opportunity to be outgoing, says activist Rekha Raj. She explains that at gender workshops, she meets lots of youngsters who question why their privacy is curtailed and just hang out and do the things they want to. “Even the conversations in our homes are changing and families are discussing the idea of sexuality, thanks to the issues and the calls for rights in the queer movement. This is a positive change; it is probably reflecting quite slowly in society, but it is happening,” she says. In Video:Malayali women's bold artDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Kerala cop Soumya murder: Accused Ajas d.description: ALAPPUZHA: Civil police officer (CPO) NA Ajas, 33, who brutally murdered woman CPO Soumya Pushpakaran and was undergoing treatment at Alappuzha Medical College Hospital, succumbed to his burn injuries on Wednesday evening. “His death was confirmed at 5.45pm. His pulse rate was low from Tuesday and his burn injuries affected the functioning of kidneys. He had more than 40% burn injuries and had infection and pneumonia. Doctors told us that cardiac arrest was the reason for his demise. The autopsy will be conducted at the MCH on Thursday,” said Vallikunnam sub-inspector Shaiju Ebrahim. District police chief K M Tomy said that though Ajas has died, they will continue the investigation and once it is over, they will place the investigation report before Kayamkulam judicial first-class magistrate court. Alappuzha judicial first-class magistrate had recorded the statements of Ajas on Sunday. According to the investigation team, Ajas, a native of Kakkanad in Ernakulam, said that he killed Soumya as she refused to marry him and kept distance from him. The relatives of Soumya informed that her funeral will be held by Thursday after her husband Sajeev, who is working in Libya, arrived here. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nThe girls say yes to khadi at Kochi\n.description: Khadi took centerstage recently, as young girls dressed themselves up in designer attire made of khadi and walked the ramp in style, at the St Teresa’s College. The event, which aimed at promoting the use of indigenous materials and exploring its immense possibilities, was an eye-opener as to how khadi can be fashionable. The fashion show had saris, casual attires and dresses in khadi, in various cuts and colours. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Fisheries sector looks at sustainable bo.description: KOCHI: The newly amended Kerala Marine Fisheries Regulation Act (KMFRA) is the first in the country that will address the carbon emission concerns from the mechanized and motorized fishing sector. There are more than 21,500 marine fishing vessels operating in the Kerala waters, of which more than 4,000 vessels are mechanized and another 11,000 accounts for motorized vessels. Studies by the Central Institute of Fisheries Technology have shown that energy efficient fishing systems including changes in the vessels, engine horsepower, gear and operations could reduce the carbon emissions. Fisheries scientists who have been working on sustainable fishing technology said that vessel design, construction and operation fishing gear and methods, adoption of advanced technology and fleet management conservation, management and enhancement of resources were the key. “Across the world studies have calculated the carbon footprint of major fish harvesting systems like trawling, purse seining, gillnetting and long lining. For example, in trawling, the global warming potential is 5.43 per kilo of fish caught,” said Leela Edwin, head, department of fishing technology, CIFT. According to a series of studies by the CIFT scientists including Leela Edwin, Dhiju Das and Renju Ravi under a project on green fishing systems for tropical seas, fisheries in India consume as much as 1378.8 million litres of fuel and releases 3.13 million tonnes of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere every year. The energy use in fishing begins from going to and from the fishing ground, dropping the nets, the fishing method, processing and transporting to consumer and this was calculated under the life cycle assessment of the individual fishing units. “CIFT has worked with the Kerala government to fix optimum limits for boat engines and fishing gears. This along with other standards for the materials will ensure that we will be able to reduce the energy consumption in the fisheries sector. This will help in the usage of sustainable gear for the fishing sector and this is now being implemented in this sector,” Leela Edwin said. Fishing vessel hull optimization, reduction of engine rpm, periodic maintenance of hull and replacement of two-stroke petrol engine to the inboard diesel engine is recommended to reduce the environmental impact related to the fishing operation. Use of high durable alternative webbing materials and appropriate use of lead sinkers will increase the life of gear and reduce environmental impacts. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Idukki church officials remove wooden cr.description: IDUKKI: The wooden crosses, which were erected atop the hills of Panchalimedu tourism point, were removed by church officials on Tuesday. Earlier, Hindu Aikyavedi had filed a complaint before Idukki district collector H Dineshan alleging that authorities of Kanayankavayal St Mary’s Church were trying to encroach upon the revenue land. They also erected a trident (trishul) atop the hill to protest the move. Following this, the collector had directed the church authorities to remove the wooden crosses. Peruvanthanam village officer R Wilson said, “Three wooden crosses were installed by the church authorities on last Good Friday. The church would erect crosses before Good Friday and would remove them. But this year, the church authorities failed to remove the crosses.”  The trident was also removed. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Op Monsoon to check drug smuggling.description: KOCHI: Considering the high probability of increase in the inflow of drugs and tobacco products during monsoon, the Ernakulam excise division has launched a special drive called Operation Monsoon led by deputy commissioner of excise K Chandra Palan to nab smugglers. The decision is in the wake of more smuggling cases being reported in the division, especially during night time. According to officials, the drive is also expected to strengthen surveillance around schools as the new academic year has begun. “Monsoon season normally witnesses increase in smuggling cases. Smugglers consider it an ideal time as patrolling and vehicle inspections could be affected by the rains. Moreover, the tight security surveillance employed during election season, which reduced crime rate over the past two months, is now over. So, there is a need to boost up patrolling,” Palan said. Vehicle checking and night patrols will be strengthened across the district and the excise department will join hands with railway protection force to conduct search operations in railway stations to monitor passengers and cargo transport. Separate units of striking force will also be deployed round the clock to act in case of any untoward incidents. Moreover, it targets to crack down on medical shops which sell drugs like Nitrazepam and Alprazolam tablets without any authorized medical prescription. This is following the information collected from some of the accused in recent cases who said that some of the medical shops are assisting smugglers. “The top narcotic secret group of Ernakulam excise division has been gathering intelligence about the drug suppliers in the city and found that ganja and Nitrazepam tablets are easily available for students, especially those studying in higher secondary level. On Tuesday, we arrested one such supplier after the details collected from a high school student, who underwent counselling at the excise Vimukthi counselling centre when his parents found ganja packet in his schoolbag. Drug menace among students is a major challenge that needs to be checked,” said Palan. The official also said that excise officials would be part of parent-teacher meetings in schools in the district. “The School Protection Groups are already associating with excise to help counsel student and gather information,” Palan said. \nAmalda Liz looks like a work of art in.description: Actress Amalda Liz, who impressed us right through her first film 'Kammattippadam,' was recently seen in Kochi setting the ramp ablaze in a fashion show. Thaikkudam Bridge to perform in Summerfe.description: KOCHI: Artists of Thaikkudam Bridge are set to be the first Indian band to perform in the 51st edition of Summerfest, considered the biggest music festival in the world. The festival has several celebrity participants including Lionel Richie, Jennifer Lopez, Megadeth and Papa Roach. The festival authenticated by the Guinness book of world records, is happening at Henry Maier festival park, Milwaukee, Wisconsin in the United States. The band will be performing at 18 venues (New York, San Francisco, Chicago, Seattle, Arizona, Dallas and Houston. The gig coordinated by Evan Murray would be held in two schedules from June 26 to June 30 and July 2 to July 7. The 11-day festival, expected to see a footfall of 9,00,000 music lovers, will feature 800 bands who would perform across 11 stages. This is for the second time that Thaikkudam Bridge is touring the US. The band has performed over 90 concerts outside India and over 400 shows inside. Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Three held with hashish oil brought for.description: KOCHI: Three youths were arrested by the city shadow police after seizing several bottles of hashish oil from them on Tuesday. The accused were identified as Sharun (23) and Sarath (22) who are siblings, and Pranav (20), all hailing from Mulavukad. According to police, they were nabbed from near Container Terminal Road on their arrival from Bengaluru from where they reportedly brought the hashish oil kept in several bottles. “The drug was meant for supplying to a rave party to be held at a private resort in the city on Saturday,” said police. “The tip-off about the party was received after we arrested a youngster last week who was waiting for drug delivery at High Court Junction. We later made him lure out the suppliers by sealing a deal and sent them a map of the location through WhatsApp for exchange of drugs. The accused believed it and got trapped,” said police. Police have launched a probe against the resort owners. Ganja peddler arrested The special squad of Ernakulam excise division arrested a 34-year-old man on charges of possession and sale of ganja on Tuesday. The sleuths seized more than 2kg of ganja from the accused who was identified as Azad (34) of Kuttamasserry at Aluva West. According to excise officials, he was arrested based on the information provided by the top narcotic secret group led by inspector B Suresh. The officials said the accused left his job abroad recently and started selling drugs. They traced him from the details collected from a high school student, who was brought to the Vimukthi counselling centre at excise zonal office at Kacheripady by his parents when they found ganja in his schoolbag. Signs of Presence art exhibition throws.description: An exhibition titled Signs of Presence being showcased at the Durbar Hall Art Centre, in Kochi, brings together the artworks of three artists such as Akhil Vijayakumar, Ayyappa Das IR and Vishnu CS. The group exhibition brings together mediums such as paintings, sculptures and graphic prints. Be it anything in life, there is a process of action and reaction, and how even presence or absence of something can convey meanings of their own. The exhibition captures the curious responses of these artists to various situations. Navy celebrates 60 years of its oldest a.description: KOCHI: The Indian Navy’s first Naval Air Squadron 550 celebrated its diamond jubilee at Naval Base in Kochi on Tuesday. The squadron has flown 14 different types of aircraft starting with the Sea Land to the Dornier maritime reconnaissance aircraft. The squadron has been part of several operations, from the 1971 Indo-Pak War to Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR) operations during the December 2004 Tsunami, Cyclone Ockhi in 2017 and the 2018 Kerala floods. To commemorate the occasion, various outreach activities and community events were conducted by the squadron. These include an organ donation awareness lecture attended by the families of officers and sailors of the Southern Naval Command. A seminar on Technological Advancements to Mitigate Challenges in Airborne Maritime Reconnaissance was conducted at Sagarika in which Vice Admiral A K Chawla, Flag Officer Commanding in Chief, SNC, was the chief guest. As part of the celebrations, a trophy in memory of late Lieutenant Simon George Pynumootil was instituted by the family of the officer to be presented to the Most Spirited Officer of the Dornier Operational Flying Training course. This trophy was instituted to pay tribute to the officer who was a qualified Islander pilot and lost his life in a fatal air crash whilst serving in the squadron on May 17, 1985. Kochi: Next, water transport to go solar.description: KOCHI: After solar-power revolutionized operations of the Cochin International Airport Limited (Cial), it is now the turn of the state water transport department (SWTD) to go eco-friendly with green energy. With the success of the first solar passenger boat, the water transport department is all set to launch three more boats in the coming months. “Aditya, our first solar boat has been running successfully for the last two years and not a trip has been cancelled. The fuel costs have just been Rs 200-280 for electricity and we have saved about Rs 48 lakhs on diesel,” said SWTD director Shaji Nair. Three of the boats including a cruise-liner will become operational in the next few months. The tendering process for the construction of another three boats will begin by the end of this year. Nair said that in contrast to the huge criticism and pressure that the department faced for venturing into solar-powered boats, Aditya is drawing international attention too. “We had senior officials from almost 40 countries visiting us recently to travel in the boat. They were part of the International solar alliance (ISA) and had come to look at the boat so that it could be replicated and customized in their countries,” he said. Of the two new boats under construction at NavAlt, one will be a return boat in the Vaikkom- Thavanakadavu route while the other would be in the Panavally-Thiruvananthapuram route. The cruise-liner will be an air-conditioned, double-decker boat and deployed in Alappuzha for ‘See Kuttanad’ programme. These boats will be powered by a hybrid battery. “During day time, we will use solar power and at night battery power,” Nair said. The first solar boat, Aditya, has completed two years of service in January. During the period, the boat carried 6, 00,000 passengers and travelled around 38,000 km without a single drop of fuel thereby saving 58,000 litres of diesel. This saved Rs 45 lakhs in diesel and maintenance cost during the period. Sandith Thandasherry, the man behind India’s first solar-powered ferry and CEO of NavAlt Solar and Electric Boats said that all countries in the tropical area were interested in the solar boats and the delegation which visited Aditya was in discussions with his company for manufacturing solar boats. He said that the ISA had offered to try to aggregate the combined demand the requirement of the countries as Aditya was a successful model of a public transport with a capacity of carrying 100 passengers. The Inland Waterways Authority of India has also evinced interest in running solar boats in the Ganga and Yamuna. “They have called for tenders for the Yamuna taxi and have kept very high technical standards,” Sandith said. Meanwhile, Kochi Metro’s water project is already looking at solar boats. Also, Cochin International Airport Limited (CIAL) is also looking at a solar-powered boat which is intended to be operated in the inland waterways. Kochi: Power board contract employee ele.description: KOCHI: A contract staff attached to the Kerala State Electricity Board (KSEB) as a lineman was electrocuted while doing maintainence on a damaged electrical post at Kadavanthara on Monday evening. The deceased was identified as Reji Kumar (45) of Valamangalam in Thuravur. The incident happened around 4.45pm near Elamkulam bus stop where he along with his team was working on a damaged post. According to Kadavanthara police, Kumar sustained electric shock after coming in contact with the electric line. Owing to the impact, he was thrown away from the ladder but got trapped on the line. After being alerted, fire officials from Gandhinagar fire station rushed to the spot and brought him down. Though he was rushed to a nearby private hospital by 5pm, he lost his life by 5.30pm. Police said a detailed probe would be launched to know the reason behind the fatal incident. “We are yet to know how it happened and whether the victim had taken any protective measure. A case has been registered for unnatural death under Section 174 of CrPC,” said the police. Ganja peddler arrested Excise sleuths in Perumbavoor on Monday arrested a 32-year-old man on charge of selling ganja. The accused was identified as Gautham Swahin of Kendrapara in Odisha. Officials seized 1.1kg of ganja from the accused who was nabbed from Ponjassery junction near Perumbavoor. According to the officials, the ganja was brought from his hometown. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kochi: Woman held for gold smuggling.description: KOCHI: The Customs air intelligence unit on Tuesday recorded the arrest of Alappuzha native Sreelakshmi Jayanti (27), a carrier for a gold smuggling racket, who reportedly dumped 2.5kg of gold in a women’s lavatory at the Cochin international airport after getting nervous during a smuggling bid about three months ago. She was later let off on conditional bail after she promised to cooperate with the probe. “She told us that she brought the gold on her person from Dubai. After dumping the gold in the lavatory next to the arrival gate, she went to Alappuzha and then returned to Dubai. She came back following a demand from the department. Now, we are trying to track down other links in the racket,” said customs commissioner Sumit Kumar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Meena Menon protests KSEB move.description: KOCHI: On Wednesday Meena Menon, the owner of Shanthivanam, cut her hair short to protest against the state government and KSEB’s move to cut down trees on her land. She added that she would give her clump of hair to the chief minister, power minister and KSEB as a mark of protest. “My action is an example of what will happen when an ordinary citizen tries to protect the environment. I have raised a lot of slogans for the party. Comrade, this is for the common man and what is happening is a violation of human rights,” she said. She had been protesting along with other environmentalists against KSEB’s move to fell trees to construction of a 11kV tower on her land. On Tuesday, Menon had said she would do so after KSEB officials informed that they would start felling trees, including 200-year-old ones, from Wednesday. A total of eight trees were to be pulled down. On Wednesday morning, Shanthivanam samrakshana Samiti protested when KSEB officials arrived. They went away and came back with a bigger police force and later started cutting down the branches of the big trees. “I have fought using all possible ways democratically. I don’t need permission to cut my hair and I am doing it. I have been waiting for the chief minister to intervene. This is how the government is planning to make the state green. When they want the land, they will just wipe out all biodiversity,” she said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ramdas Athawale.description: NEW DELHI: Union minister and Republican Party of India leader Ramdas Athawale on Wednesday left members of the Lok Sabha, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in peels of laughter with his witty remarks, some aimed at Congress president Rahul Gandhi. In his congratulatory remarks after the unanimous election of Om Birla as Lok Sabha Speaker, Athawale, who has a knack for spontaneous humour, said he is happy that Rahul got a chance to sit in Lok Sabha though as an opposition member. While Rahul won from Wayanad in Kerala, he lost the Gandhi stronghold of Amethi in Uttar Pradesh to Smriti Irani. #WATCH:Ramdas Athawale in Lok Sabha says,"Rahul ji aapko wahan baithne ka mauka mila isiliye aapko badhai deta hoon… https://t.co/cRPL9IbuWV— ANI (@ANI) 1560939466000"Rahul ji aapko wahan baithne ka mauka mila isiliye aapko badhai deta hoon. Jab apki satta thi tab main aapke saath tha. Chunav ke pehle mujhe Congress wale bol rahe the idhar aao. Maine hawa ka rukh dekha ki woh Modi ji ki taraf ja rahi hai (I congratulate you on getting an opportunity to sit there (in the Opposition benches). I was with the UPA when it was in power. Congress leaders asked me to join them again ahead of elections. But I saw which way the wind was blowing and decided to remain with NDA," he said. Rahul and Sonia took his remarks sportingly and were seen smiling. When the RPI leader was speaking, Modi was seen laughing on more than two occasions. "Now, our government will run for five years, and for another five years ... Modi sahib will continue to do the good work. We will not let you come this side (treasury benches) so easily," Athawale said, amid thumping of desks by NDA members. Read this story in MarathiIn Video:Ramdas Athawale takes a dig at Rahul Gandhi in Lok Sabha, evokes laughterDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

\nActor Farhaan Faasil sports a stylish.description: While his brother and actor Fahadh Faasil handles a variety of looks with ease, Farhaan Faasil is mostly spotted in his carefree yet cool signature style.  However, at a recent literary event in Kochi, the actor sported a never-seen-much-before whisker and what's more, he carried it off with elan! Farhaan, who has just completed his romcom 'Basheerinte Premalekhanam,' had the company of many renowned directors of Mollywood including his dad Fazil, Siby Malayil, Kamal, Joshiy and Lal Jose.  Meanwhile, Fazil recalled his days and shared vignettes from his life as a director much to the delight of his friends from the film industry. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nSpotted Kavya Madhavan at the celebrat.description: Kavya Madhavan dazzled in a black sari at the function held in Trivandrum to mark the completion of 50 years in cinema for Malayalam filmmaker Adoor Gopalakrishnan. At the event the 75-year-old master craftsman was felicitated by his friends from all walks of life. The event was an informal gathering where actress Kavya and Kavya Madhavan shared their experiences working with Adoor. Actors like Madhupal, Manoj K Jayan, Nandu and Manju Pillai were some of the celebs who joined the celebrations, organised by Federation of the Film Societies of India’s Kerala chapter. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North.
